etymologies: mid 17th century (as a noun): from Latin, from spondere ‘promise solemnly’. The verb dates from the late 19th century

definitions: an individual or organization that pays some or all of the costs involved in staging a sporting or artistic event in return for advertising

examples.text: the production cost $50,000, most coming from local sponsors

shortDefinitions: person or organization that pays for or contributes to costs involved in staging sporting or artistic event in return for advertising

definitions: a person who pledges to donate a certain amount of money to another person after they have participated in a fund-raising event organized on behalf of a charity.
shortDefinitions: person who pledges to donate certain amount of money

definitions: a business or organization that pays for or contributes to the costs of a radio or television program in return for advertising

examples.text: NBC found a sponsor willing to put the election up on prime time

shortDefinitions: business or organization that pays for or contributes to costs of radio

definitions: a person who introduces and supports a proposal for legislation

examples.text: a leading sponsor of the bill

shortDefinitions: person who introduces and supports proposal for legislation

definitions: a person taking official responsibility for the actions of another

examples.text: they act as informants, sponsors, and contacts for new immigrants

shortDefinitions: person taking official responsibility for actions of another

definitions: a godparent at a child's baptism.
(especially in the Roman Catholic Church) a person presenting a candidate for confirmation

examples.text: Paul has asked me to be his sponsor for confirmation next month

definitions: provide funds for (a project or activity or the person carrying it out)

examples.text: Joe is being sponsored by his church

definitions: pay some or all of the costs involved in staging (a sporting or artistic event) in return for advertising

examples.text: the event is sponsored by Cathay Pacific

shortDefinitions: pay some or all of costs involved in staging sporting or artistic event in return for advertising

definitions: pledge to donate a certain sum of money to (someone) after they have participated in a fund-raising event organized on behalf of a charity

examples.text: she wishes to thank all those people who sponsored her

shortDefinitions: pledge to donate certain sum of money

definitions: introduce and support (a proposal) in a legislative assembly
shortDefinitions: introduce and support proposal in legislative assembly

definitions: propose and organize (negotiations or talks) between other people or groups

examples.text: the U.S. sponsored negotiations between the two sides

shortDefinitions: propose and organize negotiations or talks between other people or groups
